message: I thought it might be fun to have a topic for people to share fun, kid-friendly meal ideas.  I have a 3 year old daughter (veggie since birth).  She's a great eater, she'll try anything and eats primarily what we eat, unless it's something really spicy and I don't feel like toning down the spice.   I'm always looking for something different to pack in her lunchbox (she goes to daycare in the mornings through lunch time).  I usually just pack leftovers.  :)
Our pug-kids love eating kale stems but I'm guess it would be a good option most "kids" :)

@mlarson I've had good luck with the Full Meal Muffins from Vegan Lunch Box when I'm looking for something low-mess. Otherwise, we're big on hummus or other bean dip with pita wedges, raw veggies and olives. (My kiddos are 5 and 2.)
